messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Konnichi wa
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Ezekiel, The book you might want to check out is: IKKI, by James white, Cornell University 1995 Unfortunately, it s not so easy to find, and quite pricey.
messages.messageBody:
Hi Ezekiel,

The book you might want to check out is:
"IKKI," by James white, Cornell University 1995
Unfortunately, it's not so easy to find, and quite pricey.

Alternatively, there is a very good article ("Ikki in late medieval
Japan") in:
"MEDIEVAL JAPAN," edited by Hall and Mass, Standford, 1974
This is usually readily available, and should not cost more than $20.-.
The other essays in this book are quite good too.

Hope it helps,
Cepo, Honolulu.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Konnichi wa
messages.msgSnippet: ... For the record, Shinto has *nothing* to do with the Ikkô-shu. It s entirely Buddhist.  Tony
messages.messageBody:
Cretescu Edward wrote:

> I can
> not found articles about the Ikko Ikki (the famous buddhist-shinto
> warriors),

For the record, Shinto has *nothing* to do with the Ikkô-shu. It's entirely
Buddhist. <G>


Tony

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Konnichi wa
messages.msgSnippet: Ezequiel Romagnoli  wrote: Gassho everyone, my name is Ezequiel, I m from argentina and I am an Aikido student. I love japanese history
messages.messageBody:
Ezequiel Romagnoli <ezemaro@...> wrote:
Gassho everyone, my name is Ezequiel, I'm from argentina and I am an
Aikido student. I love japanese history (specialli the martial part). I can
not found articles about the Ikko Ikki (the famous buddhist-shinto
warriors), I read a little bit only of them, but i still want more!!, it's
very exciting the way they fought against major numbers, but they always won
(exept with Oda Nobunaga). I also like Ninjas' history, and one of this days
i'm going to write an article about them.

Domo arigato, and Gassho!

messages.subject: Konnichi wa
messages.msgSnippet: Gassho everyone, my name is Ezequiel, I m from argentina and I am an Aikido student. I love japanese history (specialli the martial part). I can not found
messages.messageBody:
Gassho everyone, my name is Ezequiel, I'm from argentina and I am an
Aikido student. I love japanese history (specialli the martial part). I can
not found articles about the Ikko Ikki (the famous buddhist-shinto
warriors), I read a little bit only of them, but i still want more!!, it's
very exciting the way they fought against major numbers, but they always won
(exept with Oda Nobunaga). I also like Ninjas' history, and one of this days
i'm going to write an article about them.

Domo arigato, and Gassho!
